node.title: Vaccinating children against COVID-19 is crucial in the NT, experts say. Here's why
node.alt: A young woman receives a vaccine shot from a nurse
node.description: The Northern Territory's best shot at preventing another COVID-19 outbreak is to vaccinate children against the coronavirus as a top priority, say medical experts.
node.content:
["The Northern Territory's best shot at preventing another COVID-19 outbreak is to vaccinate children against the coronavirus\u00a0as a top priority, say medical experts.\u00a0", "Their advice came after Australia's Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) provisionally approved the Pfizer vaccine on Sunday\u00a0for children between five and 11 years of age.", "On Monday, the lockout in Katherine was extended for a further 24 hours after the\u00a0NT recorded one new coronavirus case in\u00a0a three-year-old girl.", "The Commonwealth government has said it expected to begin the rollout of the vaccine to children aged five\u00a0to 11\u00a0years old\u00a0from January 10, in time for the start of the 2022 school year, once it was approved by the Australian Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (ATAGI).\u00a0", "Cassandra Berry, a professor of viral immunology at Murdoch University, said children in this age group would receive one third of the vaccine dose currently being\u00a0administered to adults.\u00a0", "\"It's a smaller dose, but it's the same type of vaccine so it will still produce the antigens in the children's cells,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"Then\u00a0the children can create their own immune response to it.\"", "
How will the rollout\u00a0work?
", "The NT government is yet to announce any specific plan to deliver vaccines to children aged five\u00a0to 11\u00a0years old, including what consent or supervision may be required to deliver the vaccine to primary school students at schools.", "On Monday, Health Minister Natasha Fyles said the government would \"provide the opportunity for families to either receive the vaccine at a clinic or through the schools as appropriate\".", "\"Younger children perhaps need a little more support from their parents and guardians and carers as we roll that program out,\" she said.", "\"We will make sure that parents are fully informed and that consent is given.\"", "", "
Ms Fyles said she welcomed the TGA's provisional approval of the Pfizer vaccine for children over five.(ABC News: Hamish Harty)
", "The NT government made vaccines accessible to children aged between 12 and 15 in August.", "The Health Department has been delivering vaccines to children in that age bracket through school immunisation programs since early September.", "Ms Fyles said delivering vaccines to younger children would help keep students at school into the future.", "\"We haven't had a huge disruption to our school years during 2020 and 2021 unlike other jurisdictions, and we very much know that the vaccine for that primary school age cohort is important to keep it that way,\" she said.", "NT Acting Chief Health Officer Dr Charles Pain said authorities were \"well prepared\" for the vaccine approval for children aged five\u00a0to 11.", "\"We will be getting our program up and running as soon as possible,\" he said.", "\"We've been anticipating it. We've been hoping for it. It's the next big advantage for us in the fight against COVID in the Territory, particularly with the age profile of our communities.\"", "
Why is it so important for the NT?
", "Data\u00a0handed to the NT government from the Doherty Institute shows the Northern Territory has a younger median age, particularly in remote communities, than other jurisdictions.", "In August, Chief Minister Michael Gunner said the NT's median age was 32 overall and about 21 in remote communities.", "That's much lower than Australia's median age of 38, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics.", "Ian Mackay, a virologist at the University of Queensland, said although disease from COVID was often \"less severe\" among young people and children, \"the younger groups are definitely involved in transmission\".\u00a0", "He said widespread vaccination of children would \"help stop that family transmission spread to elder groups and those who have underlying health conditions\".", "Dr Mackay said this was especially important in remote Indigenous communities, where overcrowding and chronic diseases were major concerns.", "\"Widespread infection will rip through a household like that where people are living closely together,\" he said.", "\"But if you're vaccinated, you prevent that from happening to some extent \u2014 not perfectly, but you do reduce the risk of that transmission.\"", "
The impact of Omicron
", "Dr Berry said the initial trend of young people escaping the worst COVID symptoms was starting to change\u00a0with the new Omicron variant of concern in South Africa.", "\"This new variant is causing more disease in young children,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"The virus is mutating and we want to be on top of it.\"", "Dr Berry\u00a0said the new variant had been particularly devastating among unvaccinated people in South Africa who were already fighting other infectious diseases like HIV or Hepatitis C, which lowers their immunity.", "She highlighted\u00a0similar health challenges with the NT's Indigenous population, which suffers a disproportionately high rate of preventable illnesses and chronic health conditions.", "\"We really need to get those vaccination rates up in the NT,\" Dr Berry\u00a0said.", "\"Their immune response is already compromised, and then the virus comes on board and can get a head start.\u00a0", "\"If we get the younger population and older people protected, we could change our family trees in the future if we act now.\"", "", "
